Query.SqlString: SELECT Top 32767 ID,Literature FROM Literature WHERE (Literature ='GC97')

BibliographicData.Title: Area V1 in macaque monkeys projects to multiple histochemically defined subdivisions of the inferior pulvinar complex

BrainSite.FullName: Nucleus pulvinaris inferior thalami, central subdivision
Nucleus pulvinaris inferior thalami, lateral subdivision
Nucleus pulvinaris inferior thalami, shell of the lateral subdivision
Nucleus pulvinaris inferior thalami, pars medialis
Nucleus pulvinaris inferior thalami, posterior subdivision

Reference.Quotation: "In one monkey, nine injections of 0.2 µl of 4% fast blue had been placed one week previously along the dorsal lip of the ectocalcarine sulcus, a location estimated to be in the upper quadrant close to the representation of the horizontal meridian."
"In the case of the fast blue injections (not shown), seperate patches of labeled neurons were observed in PIl and PIl-s but not in the other divisions."
"In the case of the fast blue injections (not shown), seperate patches of labeled neurons were observed in PIl and PIl-s but not in the other divisions."

"Fig.2: ... injections sites of ... 35S-Methionine into V1 of rhesus monkey TMT." (legend to Fig.2) "The radiolabeled tracer appeared confined to V1 and did not produce callosal label."

"In the two cases [GC97-cTMT-TAA and GC97-cTMT-WGA], similar correlations were found between chemoarchitectonic subdivisions and labeled connedtions with V1, and the illustrated case shows the main findings (Figs. 1-3). Striate cortex was found to connect with four of the histochemically distinct zones in PI. The largest zone was found within PIl... The lateral-shell zone contained thin patches of label... Dense patches of connections were found in PIm... A small focus of of lighter terminations occupied PIc. Projections to PIp were not observed."

TracerSubstance.FullName: Horseradish peroxidase, conjugated to wheat germ agglutinin

Reference.Quotation: "...injections sites of WGA-HRP ... into V1 of rhesus monkey TMT." (legend to Fig. 2) "... the WGA-HRP deposits were centered approximately 2 mm caudal to the V1/V2 border, and the tracer approached but did not cross the V2 border."
Reference.Comments: There was a light reaction product in the upper bank of the lunate sulcus. The authors state that it it appears unlikely to produce thalamic label.
